Line 12: Line 12:
'''Android''' is a [[platform (computing)|software platform]] and [[operating system]] for [[mobile device]]s, based on the [[Linux]] [[kernel]], developed by [[Google]] and later the [[Open Handset Alliance]].<ref name="AndroidAnnoucement">{{cite web |url=http://www.openhandsetalliance.com/press_110507.html |title=Industry Leaders Announce Open Platform for Mobile Devices |accessdate=2007-11-05 |date=2007-11-05 |format=HTML |work= |publisher=[[Open Handset Alliance]] |language=English}}</ref> It allows developers to write [[managed code]] in a [[Java (programming language)|Java]]-like language that utilizes Google-developed Java libraries,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.news.com/8301-13580_3-9815495-39.html | title=Google's Android parts ways with Java industry group}}</ref> but does not support programs developed in [[native code]].<ref name="AndroidGeneralFAQ">{{cite web |url=http://code.google.com/android/kb/general.html#c |title=General Android |accessdate=2008-08-29}}</ref>
'''Android''' is a [[platform (computing)|software platform]] and [[operating system]] for [[mobile device]]s, based on the [[Linux]] [[kernel]], developed by [[Google]] and later the [[Open Handset Alliance]].<ref name="AndroidAnnoucement">{{cite web |url=http://www.openhandsetalliance.com/press_110507.html |title=Industry Leaders Announce Open Platform for Mobile Devices |accessdate=2007-11-05 |date=2007-11-05 |format=HTML |work= |publisher=[[Open Handset Alliance]] |language=English}}</ref> It allows developers to write [[managed code]] in a [[Java (programming language)|Java]]-like language that utilizes Google-developed Java libraries,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.news.com/8301-13580_3-9815495-39.html | title=Google's Android parts ways with Java industry group}}</ref> but does not support programs developed in [[native code]].<ref name="AndroidGeneralFAQ">{{cite web |url=http://code.google.com/android/kb/general.html#c |title=General Android |accessdate=2008-08-29}}</ref>
â
The unveiling of the Android platform on [[5 November]] [[2007]] was announced with the founding of the Open Handset Alliance, a consortium of 34 [[Computer hardware|hardware]], [[Computer software|software]], and [[Telecommunication|telecom]] companies devoted to advancing [[open standard]]s for mobile devices.<ref name="OHAhome">{{cite web |url=http://www.openhandsetalliance.com/ |title=Open Handset Alliance |accessdate=2007-11-06 |format=HTML |publisher=Open Handset Alliance |language=English}}</ref> Google has pledged to make most of the Android platform available under the [[Apache license|Apache]] [[free software license|free-software]] and [[open-source license]].<ref name="AndroidOverview">{{cite web|url=http://www.openhandsetalliance.com/android_overview.html|title=Open Handset Alliance|accessdate=2008-09-23}}</ref>
+
The unveiling of the Android platform on [[5 November]] [[2007]] was announced with the founding of the Open Handset Alliance, a consortium of 34 [[Computer hardware|hardware]], [[Computer software|software]], and [[Telecommunication|telecom]] companies devoted to advancing [[open standard]]s for mobile devices.<ref name="OHAhome">{{cite web |url=http://www.openhandsetalliance.com/ |title=Open Handset Alliance |accessdate=2007-11-06 |format=HTML |publisher=Open Handset Alliance |language=English}}</ref> Google has pledged to make most of the Android platform available under the [[Apache license|Apache]] [[free software license|free-software]] and [[open source license]].<ref name="AndroidOverview">{{cite web|url=http://www.openhandsetalliance.com/android_overview.html|title=Open Handset Alliance|accessdate=2008-09-23}}</ref>
